title: 1962 Reg Harris bicycle decal
content:
Hi,

I am restoring an old Reg Harris bicycle and am recreating the transfers. I’ve artworked most of them now, but am having problems identifying the fonts (have spent rather too long looking and can’t really see the wood for the tree...)

The first font is for the model name (Record in my case, but I believe it’s the same as this one):

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20091109221259im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Reg_Pro_toptube_decal_3973.JPG)

The second font is from the crest on the seat tube (“Reg Harris Cycles Ltd England”), this one is driving me particularly crazy because I’m sure it’s obvious, but I can’t seem to get it (it’s a basic grotesk of some sort...)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20091109221259im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Reg_Pro_seattube_decal_1_5721.JPG)

Many thanks in advance for all help,

Crispin Jones
author: crispin-jones

comments.content: The gold outline makes _Professional_ tough to decipher, but _Reg Harris (Cycles) Ltd._ is done in the style of Edward Johnston’s 1916 alphabet for the London Underground, and _England_ looks like the same thing, but slightly bolder and more condensed.
Thanks for the suggestion, but I don’t think Johnston is right - the aperture on the “R” is too small on Johnston...
